text: I don’t, actually
I was thinking about it on the rebuild, actually
there are a couple of those effects in green
Especially since rats are cheaper to cast
yeah, I think the argument for it in relentless rats is probably stronger, you get more of a discount that way
or [[Descendent's Path]]?

text: with colony it would be only 2 discount on mana, where as with relentless it’s 5
if it were instant it’d be one of the best cards in the deck by far
hm
maybe, it does give me a re-draw
don’t know what I’d cut for it off the top of my head though
The eternal problem with Rats and Apostles is balancing the density you need with all the fun stuff that enables them
pretty much
it’s rough
it’s fun to do though
it’s why apostles is so much stronger from a distance: that low cmc allows for less ramp, giving you more room for fun stuff
Speaking of, CK is paying $1.30 per Apostle
Well, $1, $1.30 in credit
I have like 60 extras
Also, on our episode, Nate mentioned that running Rats or Apostles made the deck building process easier and Patrick and I were like "Noooo. Nonono."
It is if you aren’t as greedy with your build as you guys :wink:
You want EVERYTHING :wink:
I enjoy a challenging brew over easy modes.
But think about if you built a deck and you had to make room for lands twice.
That's basically what brewing Apostles is.
Just to make sure I'm not missing anything:
[[Ranger's path]]

text: is generally better than [[explosive vegetation]]

attachments.text:
Sorcery
Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
_Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns._

text: If you are ok with just forest kinds, then yes
In mono green the difference is neglible, but Path gets you Dryad Arbor
And Sapseep Forest I guess
So I'd call it better
It isn’t a blindly jam into every green deck though
In three color Path can get duals, so I'd say it's generally better in 3+ color decks
So maybe in two color enemy pair decks where the only duals are ABUR and shocks then maybe Veggies, because it lets you fix
I think if my deck was very slanted green mana for some reason, then I would be more likely to run veggies
And technically [[hunting wilds]] is a better Ranger's Path

attachments.fallback: Hunting Wilds {3}{G} // Sorcery // Kicker {3}{G} (You may pay an additional {3}{G} as you cast this spell.) // Search your library for up to two Forest cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library. // If Hunting Wilds was kicked, untap all Forests put onto the battlefield this way. They become 3/3 green creatures with haste that are still lands.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
Kicker {3}{G} _(You may pay an additional {3}{G} as you cast this spell.)_
Search your library for up to two Forest cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
If Hunting Wilds was kicked, untap all Forests put onto the battlefield this way. They become 3/3 green creatures with haste that are still lands.
attachments.title: Hunting Wilds {3}{G}

text: That being said, 4 mana ramp is always tough to find a spot for
Sure, but even if it's slanted for green you can grab shocks, OG duals, battles, and cyclers
that get you green and another color
At the point though I’m sure I would have fetched those out by the time I cast it
So basically you might go for Veggies in an enemy two color deck favoring green, but that's about it. Beyond that Path, Wilds, and Claim are better, and that's just at the four drop slot
That was all my point was!
In general those are better for realz
In looking at it you should really literally never run Explosive Vegetation unless your deck wants like 15 ramp spells
Even then you’d probably do better running a draw spell at four instead
Or Sprouting Vines or something like Acid Moss
Clearly I'm doing an In the Margins on Veggies
I see you are starting to write your next....
I cut veggies from my Borbo deck because it was so limp, four is just too much for what it does
Yeah, honestly I probably wouldn't run any four drop one but Claim
But if you're gonna there's at least three options that are gonna almost always be better, and i haven't even gotten into the cheaper to cast options
Nature's Lore. So good.
Does Search for Tomorrow make your list?
I’ve never been impressed by that one either
The only time it’s amazing is turn one with an untapped green source
Search is on there but I haven't gotten to three drops yet, did 4 and two because it's easy to compare
Oops, not Search, was thinking of Far Wanderings
Search should go into the maybes for three though once I figure out how to quantify that
Though there's probably enough things at 2 and 4 to just say "never run veggies"
I also like [[!Spoils of War]]
Nope, not that
[[!Spoils of Victory]]
Spoils sweet spot is for the 4-color commanders. You can cast it on turn three, get a dual or even Murmuring Bosk to fix, and cast that commander on 4
I run it in Vial Smasher and Thrasios
Which is basically a four color
Yeah, it is 4 color.
